page.title: 11The Caravan Centre.
page.content: Brooklea Caravan Centre is on the main Road near the centre of the village. The lightest caravan was one hundred weight and the heaviest was just over hundred tons. The people who owned the caravan centre were called Mr and Mrs Birkly they sell 150 new caravans a year and 200 used caravans a year. The land that the caravans are on occupies 2 acres. They have had 9 caravans stolen in the last 9 years.Before the Caravan Centre was on its' present site there was a petrol station on the site once.The caravan centre had been there for 9 years.They sold accessories but they are stopping it because a lot of it was stolen. There are 6 people employed at the Centre and of these two work in the workshop.
